alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 7:29AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish, central Hancock and south central Pearl River Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 728 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lacombe, or 9 miles west of Slidell, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Picayune, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Kiln, Lacombe, Stennis Space Center, Pearlington and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 259 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 10. Interstate 12 between mile markers 74 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock
